The founder of Moneysavingexpert.com has had his say on how Brexit could impact the housing market.
Britain's process of leaving the European Union remains shrouded in uncertainty, leaving prospective house buyers nervous about their investments.
The Mirror reports Martin Lewis has now given his views on the matter on his ITV show.
He said: “The one thing that is certain is uncertainty.
“That is what’s worrying everyone." Read More Money Saving Expert Martin Lewis' tips on how to beat unfair parking charges
But that doesn't mean it's a bad time to move or get a new mortgage.
“A fixed rate mortgage is by definition ‘certain’. If you want certainty in these uncertain times, that’s what it does," Mr Lewis explained.
And now could be the perfect time to get one. Martin Lewis
“Mortgage rates are still near historic lows. There isn’t that much room for interest rates to drop, and lots of room for them to rise," he added.
And house prices?
“Who knows? The Bank of England predicts a 30% drop in the event of a ‘no deal’," Mr Lewis said. Read More
“That may be far-fetched, but it may be good for first-time buyers because it’s good price."
So what's Mr Lewis' advice? Look to yourself, not try and predict the future.
“I would ignore externalities. The more important thing is have you saved up a decent deposit? Is it a house you want to live in?," he said.
“I don’t think the period of uncertainty is expected to stop any time soon.” Like us on Facebook
